03/02/2011~~~food for thought~~~LEAN ON JESUS OUR SALVATION

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"Whom have I in heaven but you? And earth has nothing I desire besides you. 
My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my 
portion forever." - Psalm 73:25-26 

Lesson for Today: (Ps. 18)
1 I love you, LORD, my strength. 
2 The LORD is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer; 
my God is my rock, in whom I take refuge, 
my shield and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold. 

The Lord is:
Our Strength ~ Our Rock ~ Our Fortress ~ Our Deliver
Our Refuge ~ Our Shield ~ Our Stronghold
The Horn of Our Salvation

What more do we need?

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, forgive me for the times I have been envious 
and ungrateful and strengthen me to believe Your promises 
and to seek Your Eternal Kingdom. Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: (Psalm 18) I love you, LORD, my strength. The LORD is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer; my God is my rock, in whom I take refuge, my shield and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold. The Lord is: Our Strength. Our Rock. Our Fortress. Our Deliver. Our Refuge. ~ Our Shield. ~ Our Stronghold. The Horn of Our Salvation. What more do we need?
original_verse_text: Whom have I in heaven but you? And earth has nothing I desire besides you. My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You are our strength, our rock, our fortress, and our deliverer. In You, we find refuge and salvation. You are our shield and our stronghold, the horn of our salvation. Lord, we have no need beyond You, for You are all-sufficient. May our love for You grow ever deeper, as we trust in Your unfailing care. Amen.
reflection: I love you, LORD, my strength. The LORD is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer; my God is my rock, in whom I take refuge, my shield and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold. The LORD is: Our Strength. Our Rock. Our Fortress. Our Deliverer. Our Refuge. Our Shield. Our Stronghold. The Horn of Our Salvation. What more do we need?
subject: Strength, Rock, Fortress, Deliverer

03/03/2011~~~food for thought~~~ATTITUDE ~ ATTITUDE ~ MAKES ALL THE DIFFERENCE

Our Verses for Today:
"But he knows the way that I take; when he has tested me, 
I will come forth as gold. My feet have closely followed his steps; 
I have kept to his way without turning aside." - Job 23:10-11 

The lesson to be learned
I believe there is one thing and one thing only that can make a difference
in how we face our every day trials, even little ones, it is our attitude.

We can have the attitude of the Pharaoh of Egypt, who when confronted
by Moses and the ten plagues from God, who grumbled, and griped, and
became stubborn, causing more woes to come upon him. ~ OR ~

that of Job, who at the loss of all his possessions, even his own health,
succumbed to the will of God and remained faithful. That kind of commitment 
to Christ will give us eternal life, happiness and joy. .

Remember ~ (Phil. 4:13) "I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me."
And (Ro. 8:28) "And we know that all things work together for good to them that 
love God."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, in every circumstance, grant me sincere repentance,
help me to remain patient in all Your ways, so that I may lift my
face to behold You and give You praise. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text:
I believe there is one thing and one thing only that can make a difference in how we face our every day trials, even little ones, it is our attitude. We can have the attitude of the Pharaoh of Egypt, who when confronted by Moses and the ten plagues from God, who grumbled, and griped, and became stubborn, causing more woes to come upon him. Or that of Job, who at the loss of all his possessions, even his own health,
succumbed to the will of God and remained faithful. That kind of commitment to Christ will give us eternal life, happiness and joy. Remember: (Philippians 4:13) I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me. And (Romans 8:28) And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God.
original_verse_text: But he knows the way that I take; when he has tested me, I will come forth as gold. My feet have closely followed his steps; I have kept to his way without turning aside.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that You are the sovereign Lord who holds our lives in Your hands. Like Job, may we remain steadfast in our faith, trusting that You are refining us through the trials we face. When the burdens of this world weigh heavily upon us, strengthen us with the power of Your Spirit, that we may declare with confidence, "If God is for us, who can be against us?" (Romans 8:31). Lord, help us to cling to Your promises, knowing that all things work together for the good of those who love You (Romans 8:28). We surrender our lives to You, for You are the source of our eternal life, happiness, and joy. Amen.

03/04/2011~~~food for thought~~~TO GOD BE THE GLORY

Verses for Today:
For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways," 
declares the LORD. "As the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my 
ways higher than your ways and my thoughts than your thoughts." - Isaiah 55:8-9 

Lesson for Today:
What is being said is that God's ways and thoughts are to vast to measure.
His ways and thoughts are beyond human understanding. .

Riches ~ Wisdom ~ knowledge ~ ~ ~ Riches, are the wealth of God's 
grace and glory. The wisdom of God purposeful actions in history to save ~ 
and His intimate knowledge of us is to deep for human beings to fathom. .

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, may Your Word continue to accomplish Your purpose among us
and around the world. ~ Teach us to hold Your Word sacred and gladly hear
and learn it. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

Riches, are the wealth of God's grace and glory. The wisdom of God purposeful actions in history to save ~ and His intimate knowledge of us is to deep for human beings to fathom.
original_verse_text:
For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways, 
declares the LORD. As the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways and my thoughts than your thoughts.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your ways and thoughts, which are far beyond our limited understanding. Your riches, wisdom, and knowledge are boundless, as You have revealed in Your Word. We confess that we cannot fully comprehend the depths of Your grace, the purpose of Your actions, or the intimate knowledge You have of each one of us. Yet, we trust in Your sovereign plan and find comfort in the truth that You see us, know us, and love us. May we humbly submit to Your will and seek to walk in Your ways. Amen.

03/05/2011~~~food for thought~~~YOU CAN NOT HIDE FROM GOD. .

Our Verse for Today:
"Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; 
do not be discouraged, for the LORD your God will be with you wherever 
you go."" - Joshua 1:9 
Our Lesson for Today: (1:1-9)
The Lord encourages Joshua with assurances of success and promises
of His presence through His empowering Word, as Joshua begins the critical 
work of conquering and allotting the Promised Land to Israel. .

If we were left alone in our sin and weakness, we would not be able to serve
God and become successful in His eyes. Yet, God enables us through the 
promises of His Scriptures. ~ He makes us strong and courageous for service
by assuring us that through Immanuel ("God with us") we are forgiven and will
inherit not a piece of land, such as Israel, but a better, eternal home. .

Suggested Prayer:
Dear Lord, fill us, with the promises of Your Word, that we might
be blessed by Your presence, and that we would serve You with 
strength and courage that we might find success through You. .Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

If we were left alone in our sin and weakness, we would not be able to serve God and become successful in His eyes. Yet, God enables us through the promises of His Scriptures. ~ He makes us strong and courageous for service by assuring us that through Immanuel ("God with us") we are forgiven and will inherit not a piece of land, such as Israel, but a better, eternal home.
original_verse_text: Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the LORD your God will be with you wherever you go.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give You thanks for Your empowering Word that strengthens and emboldens us for the tasks You have set before us. Like Joshua, we find courage and success not in our own abilities, but in Your abiding presence and the promises of Your Scriptures. Grant us the faith to trust in Your sovereign plan, and the strength to faithfully serve You, for we can do all things through Christ who gives us power. Amen.

03/06/2011~~~food for thought~~~TREASURE HIS WORD UPON YOUR HEART

Verses for Today:
"These commandments that I give you today are to be on your hearts. 
Impress them on your children. Talk about them when you sit at home 
and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you 
get up." - Deuteronomy 6: 6-7 

Lesson for Today:
When you read the words "on your heart" it means you should always 
remember and let them be inwardly treasured. .

"Teach them diligently" is a reminder that parents are to teach God's 
Word faithfully and repeatedly to their children so that God will continually 
dwell with His people. We are also reminded that we have numerous 
opportunities to talk with our children about what God has done. .

As Christians, we should take every opportunity to discuss what God has 
done through Christ, no matter where we are or what we are doing. .

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, we thank You for parents, relatives, friends, 
and pastors who speak Your Word in purity and truth.
Use us now as instruments for the salvation of others. Amen.


Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

"Teach them diligently" is a reminder that parents are to teach God's Word faithfully and repeatedly to their children so that God will continually dwell with His people. We are also reminded that we have numerous opportunities to talk with our children about what God has done. As Christians, we should take every opportunity to discuss what God has done through Christ, no matter where we are or what we are doing.

Help us to treasure Your commands in our hearts and take every opportunity to speak of Your mighty works, that our children may know and love You all their days. May Your truth dwell richly within us, that we may walk in Your ways and pass on a legacy of faith to the next generation. Amen.

When was the last time [you] gave praise to the Lord in such a way? 
"Lord, You are my God; I will exalt You and praise Your name,

accomplished for us by Your death on the cross. Amen.

03/08/2011~~~food for thought~~~COMPLETELY KNOWN. .

Our Verses for Today:
"Search me, God, and know my heart; test me and know my anxious thoughts. 
See if there is any offensive way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting." - Psalm 139:23-24 

Our Lesson for Today:
"Searched me and known me! ~ What this is saying is that God is omniscient;
He knows everything about us. ~ This includes knowing our every action, our
every thought, even our future, even our very future, with perfect intimacy. .

Like the Psalmist we should ask God to extend His omniscience to our inner life, 
to search out the traces of sin in our lives, so that God's presence might lead us 
to everlasting life. .

Suggested Prayer:
Thank You Lord for knowing us so completely. Lead us to agree 
with your judgement against sin, especially with the sins in our 
own lives. Cleanse us with Christ's blood, born of the virgin Mary, 
who is present for our or salvation in His Word and sacraments. Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

Lord, we ask that You would examine us, test our thoughts and our ways, and reveal any trace of sin or wickedness within us. May Your perfect knowledge lead us to repentance and guide us on the path of everlasting life. Cleanse us, O God, and make us wholly Yours. Amen.

03/09/2011~~~food for thought~~~OUR COMFORT IN TIMES OF TROUBLE

Our Verses for Today:
"[Praise to the God of All Comfort] Praise be to the God and Father of 
our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of compassion and the God of all comfort, 
who comforts us in all our troubles, so that we can comfort those in any trouble 
with the comfort we ourselves receive from God." - 2 Corinthians 1:3-4 

The Lesson for Today:
"Praise to the God of all comfort," Paul begins verse 3 with worship to the God
who brings grace and peace. Yes our Lord is worthy to be praised and worshiped. .

"Who comforts us," Let us remember that a Christians comfort comes through 
the message of reconciliation with God through the work of Jesus Christ. This 
letter also shows how believers are agents of God's consolation and comfort for 
others (7:5-9). .

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, teach us to be open to the challenging experiences that
loving others in Your name brings, so we might trust in You all the more
and rejoice when others come to faith in You because they have known
us as your people. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Praise to the God of all comfort,  Paul begins verse 3 with worship to the God who brings grace and peace. Yes our Lord is worthy to be praised and worshiped. Who comforts us, Let us remember that a Christians comfort comes through the message of reconciliation with God through the work of Jesus Christ. This letter also shows how believers are agents of God's consolation and comfort for others.
original_verse_text: Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of compassion and the God of all comfort, who comforts us in all our troubles, so that we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You as the God of all comfort and the source of every blessing. You have graciously chosen us in Christ before the foundation of the world, that we might be holy and blameless before You. In Your great love, You console us in our afflictions and empower us to comfort others with the comfort we have received from You. May we ever be mindful of Your compassion and share it with those who need Your peace and healing. Amen.
reflection: Praise to the God of all comfort. Paul begins verse 3 with worship to the God who brings grace and peace. Yes, our Lord is worthy to be praised and worshiped. Who comforts us? Let us remember that a Christian's comfort comes through the message of reconciliation with God through the work of Jesus Christ. This letter also shows how believers are agents of God's consolation and comfort for others.
subject: Praise the God of Comfort

03/10/2011~~~food for thought~~~YOU HAVE BEEN CHOSEN BY GRACE IN CHRIST.

Our Verse for Today:
"He has saved us and called us to a holy life-not because of anything 
we have done but because of his own purpose and grace. This grace 
was given us in Christ Jesus before the beginning of time," - 2 Timothy 1:9

The Lesson for Today:
"He has called us to a holy life." ~ Though Paul may have been speaking
primarily about the pastoral office that he and Timothy shared, his reference
to "a holy calling" applies to all who live by faith. .

A Christian's daily work is indeed a holy calling and a priestly work because
of God's gift of faith, "not because of our works." Christian holiness is not 
rooted in what we do, but in God's work for us and through us in Christ.

"Purpose and grace, before the beginning of time." God knew, even before 
creation, that in the fullness of time, He would give His Son to die for us. "Before
we existed, yes, even before the foundation of the world was laid ~ when, of
course, we could do nothing good ~ we were chosen by grace in Christ to
salvation, according to God's purpose. .

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You Lord Jesus, for Your promise never to leave 
me or forsake me. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: He has called us to a holy life. Though Paul may have been speaking primarily about the pastoral office that he and Timothy shared, his reference to a holy calling applies to all who live by faith. A Christian's daily work is indeed a holy calling and a priestly work because of God's gift of faith, not because of our works.  Christian holiness is not rooted in what we do, but in God's work for us and through us in Christ. Purpose and grace, before the beginning of time. God knew, even before creation, that in the fullness of time, He would give His Son to die for us. Before we existed, yes, even before the foundation of the world was laid ~ when, of course, we could do nothing good ~ we were chosen by grace in Christ to salvation, according to God's purpose.
original_verse_text: He has saved us and called us to a holy life-not because of anything we have done but because of his own purpose and grace. This grace was given us in Christ Jesus before the beginning of time,
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the holy calling You have placed upon our lives. Though we are unworthy, You have chosen us by Your grace, before the foundation of the world, to be conformed to the image of Your Son. May we walk in a manner worthy of this calling, not relying on our own works, but resting in the purpose and grace You have established in Christ. Use us, Lord, to fulfill Your eternal plan. Amen.

Though Paul may have been speaking primarily about the pastoral office that he and Timothy shared, his reference to a holy calling applies to all who live by faith. 03/11:2011~~~food for thought~~~YOU BELONG TO GOD'S CHOSEN PEOPLE.

Verse for Today:
"But in your hearts revere Christ as Lord. Always be prepared to give an answer to 
everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do this 
with gentleness and respect," - 1 Peter 3:15 

The Lesson for Today:
"In your hearts revere Christ as Lord." A Christian's witness begins with a person's
own faith. ~ We must know what we believe, teach,and confess according to God's 
Word. .

"Prepare to give an answer." Christians are to be prepared to tell others about this 
truth whenever they have the opportunity. Remember the world is always watching
the Christian's faithful response to adversity, which may cause them to seek the reason 
and so hear the Gospel. .

When we put our faith into practice, living the love that God gives us in Christ Jesus,
we fulfill our purpose as God's church. .

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to remain faithful even during times of adversity
so that no one would stumble because of my actions. .Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

Prepare to give an answer. Christians are to be prepared to tell others about this truth whenever they have the opportunity. Remember the world is always watching the Christian's faithful response to adversity, which may cause them to seek the reason and so hear the Gospel. When we put our faith into practice, living the love that God gives us in Christ Jesus, we fulfill our purpose as God's church.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ. Help us to always be prepared to give a reason for the hope that we have, that others may see Your love and grace at work in our lives. Give us courage to boldly proclaim the Gospel, not ashamed of the power of salvation that comes through Your Son. May our lives be a faithful witness to Your truth, that many may come to know You. In Jesus' name, Amen.

02/12/2011~~~food for thought~~~GOD'S GRACE IS UNENDING

Our Verse for Today:
"Know therefore that the LORD your God is God; he is the faithful God, 
keeping his covenant of love to a thousand generations of those who love 
him and keep his commandments." - Deuteronomy 7:9 

A Lesson to be Learned:
"Steadfast love" Unlike sinful human beings, God fulfills each promise;
He remains steadfast in His love toward those who love Him. .

"A thousand generations." There are no time limits on God's abundant
mercy for those who love Him. God's love and grace never end. .

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord of all creation, we thank You for the precious 
foretelling of deliverance made known to Your ancient 
people and delivered in Christ Jesus, our Lord. Grant 
us encouragement in Your precious Word. Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your steadfast love and faithfulness that endure forever. Your promises stand firm for a thousand generations, and Your mercies never come to an end. We are in awe of Your unwavering devotion toward those who love You, for Your love is greater than we can fathom. May we ever be grateful for Your abundant grace and cling to Your unwavering promises. Amen.

03/13/2011~~~food for thought~~~WE HAVE BEEN CALLED BY HIS GRACE AND GOODNESS

The Verse for Today:
His divine power has given us everything we need for a godly life 
through our knowledge of him who called us by his own glory and goodness. 
"Through these he has given us his very great and precious promises, 
so that through them you may participate in the divine nature, having 
escaped the corruption in the world caused by evil desires." - 2 Peter 1:3-4 

The Lesson for Today:
"His divine power," God the Holy Spirit works through the Word to call us
to faith, giving us the knowledge that results in eternal life and that fosters 
our life in Christ.. 

"Everything" Not everything we want but everything we need for life and godliness.
Yes we shall have all that God has, for in Him we gain wisdom,, righteousness,
strength, and life. We grasp it with our ears and have it in the Word of God. .

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, we thank You for granting us all things that pertain
to life and godliness, that by Your grace there will be richly
provided for us, an entrance into Your eternal Kingdom. Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

Not everything we want but everything we need for life and godliness. Yes we shall have all that God has, for in Him we gain wisdom,, righteousness,strength, and life. We grasp it with our ears and have it in the Word of God.

Through these he has given us his very great and precious promises, so that through them you may participate in the divine nature, having escaped the corruption in the world caused by evil desires.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for Your divine power that calls us to faith through Your Word. By the work of the Holy Spirit, grant us the knowledge that leads to eternal life and the wisdom to live godly lives. May we find in You all that we need - righteousness, strength, and the fullness of life. Help us to grasp tightly the treasures You have provided in Your Scriptures. Amen.

03/14/2011~~~food for thought~~~GOD'S SPIRIT HELPS US IN OUR FRAILTY

The Verse for Today:
"And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, 
who have been called according to his purpose." - Romans 8:28 

The Lesson for Today:
"For the good of those who love God." God works in "everything" not just isolated
incidents for our good. This does not mean that all that happens to us is good. .

Evil is prevalent in our fallen world, but God is able to turn every circumstance around
for our long range good. We need to note that God is not working to make us happy 
but to fulfill His purpose. We need to realize also that this is not for everyone. .

It can only be claimed by those who love God and are called by Him, that is those whom 
the Holy Spirit convinces to receive Christ. Such people have a new perspective, a new 
mind-set. They trust in God, not in worldly treasures, their security is in heaven. Not on
earth. .

Their faith in God does not waver in pain and persecution because they know God is 
with them. .

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord I pray that Your Spirit would help us
in our frailty, assuring us of Your steadfast love.
never leave us or forsake us. turn our complaints 
into prayers and our condemnation into glory. .Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

Such people have a new perspective, a new mindset. They trust in God, not in worldly treasures, their security is in heaven. Not on earth. Their faith in God does not waver in pain and persecution because they know God is with them.

Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not lean on our own understanding, but to acknowledge You in all our ways, that You may direct our paths. May our security and hope be found in You alone, not in the fleeting treasures of this world. Give us the faith to persevere through pain and persecution, knowing that You are with us always. Amen.

03/15/2011~~~food for thought~~~LEARNING TO KNOW GOD BETTER THROUGH FAITH

The Verses for Today:
"For this very reason, make every effort to add to your faith goodness; 
and to goodness, knowledge; and to knowledge, self-control; and to 
self-control, perseverance; and to perseverance, godliness; and to godliness, 
mutual affection; and to mutual affection, love. For if you possess these 
qualities in increasing measure, they will keep you from being ineffective and 
unproductive in your knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ." - 2 Peter 1:5-8 

The Lesson for Today:
Truly ~ faith must be more than a belief in certain facts ~ It must result in action,
growth in Christian character, and the practice of moral discipline, or it will die away
(James 2:14-17). .

A life of faith leads to learning to know God better, self control, patient insurance,
godliness, goodness, and loving others. These actions do not come automatically,
they require hard work. ~ They are not optional; all of them must be a continual part 
of the Christian life. .

Prayer Suggestion:
O Lord, I thank you for granting us all things that pertain to
life and godliness, that by Your grace there will be richly 
provided for us an entrance into Your eternal kingdom. .Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

A life of faith leads to learning to know God better, self control, patient insurance, godliness, goodness, and loving others. These actions do not come automatically, they require hard work. ~ They are not optional; all of them must be a continual part of the Christian life.

For if you possess these qualities in increasing measure, they will keep you from being ineffective and unproductive in your knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to grow in our faith and walk with You. Help us to not merely believe, but to put our faith into action, cultivating the virtues of self-control, godliness, and love for others. May our lives be a reflection of Your transforming power, as we are renewed in our minds and conformed to the image of Your Son. Grant us the wisdom and discipline to pursue these qualities diligently, that we may know You more deeply and bring glory to Your name. Amen.

A life of faith leads to learning to know God better, self control, patient insurance, godliness, goodness, and loving others. These actions do not come automatically, they require hard work. ~ They are not optional; all of them must be a continual part of the Christian life.

03/16/2011~~~food for thought~~~THERE IS SALVATION ONLY IN OUR LORD. .

The Verses for Today:
"then know this, you and all the people of Israel: It is by the name of Jesus Christ 
of Nazareth, whom you crucified but whom God raised from the dead, that this man 
stands before you healed. Salvation is found in no one else, for there is no other name 
under heaven given to mankind by which we must be saved."" - Acts 4:10,12 

The Lesson for Today:
Christianity is the one true faith because Jesus, ~ the only source of
salvation, rescues us from the evil one. He delivers all people from a 
verdict of damnation and heals ills of body and soul. .

"Christ's name is received only by faith. ~ Therefore, we are saved by
confidence in Christ's name, and not by confidence in our works.
For 'the name' here means the cause that is mentioned, because of
which salvation is gained. .

To call upon Christ's name is to trust in His name as the cause, or price,
because of which we are saved. .

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, give us courage to stand firm in the 
name of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. .Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

He delivers all people from a verdict of damnation and heals ills of body and soul. For "the name" here means the cause that is mentioned, because of which salvation is gained. To call upon Christ's name is to trust in His name as the cause, or price, because of which we are saved.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the gift of salvation through Your Son, Jesus Christ. We give thanks that in His name alone, we are delivered from the grip of the evil one and rescued from a verdict of damnation. Lord, may we ever trust in the power of Christ's name, not in our own works, for it is by faith in Him that we are saved. We humbly ask that You continue to heal the ills of our body and soul, that we may walk in the light of Your truth. Amen.

03/17/2011~~~food for thought~~~CALLED TO BE HIS REPRESENTATIVE

The Verse for Today:
"Therefore, as God's chosen people, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves 
with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness and patience." - Colossians 3:12 

The Lesson for Today:
How would you began the day if you were reminded each morning,
that God has chosen us to be Christ's representative on earth. .

In light of this truth, Paul challenges us to live lives worthy of the calling 
we have received. Stop for a moment ~ ~ ~ think of the awesome
privilege we have being called Christ's very own. 

This includes being humble, gentle, patient, understanding, and peaceful.
Remember ~ if you claim to be a Christian people are watching your life.
Can they see Christ in you? ~ How well are you doing as His representative?

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, though You are exalted at the Fathers right hand,
You still hold us. Keep us in Your love to the end. .Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

Help us to live lives worthy of this calling, clothed in humility, gentleness, patience, and understanding. May our actions and attitudes reflect the love and peace of Christ, so that others may see Your Son in us. Guide us, Lord, to die to ourselves and be transformed by the renewing of our minds, that we may discern and do Your will. In Jesus' name, Amen.

10/18/2011~~~food for thought~~~LED BY THE HAND THAT STILLED THE WATERS

The Verses for Today:
"A psalm of David. The LORD is my shepherd, I lack nothing. 
He makes me lie down in green pastures, he leads me beside quiet waters, 
he refreshes my soul. He guides me along the right paths for his name's sake." - Psalm 23:1-3 

The Lesson for Today:
"Shepherd" As a shepherd cares for all the needs of his flock, God cares for every
human need: physical, emotional, and spiritual.
"Pastures" God provides abundantly and daily.
"Restores" A shepherd protects his sheep and keeps them alive by his care.
The Good Shepherd does even more. ~ He cares for every human need.
Ultimately, Christ alone restore our soul as he sacrificed His life for His sheep.
Shepherd lead sheep along safe paths, to the proper destination.
Jesus Himself is the way, the righteous path (Jn 14:6).

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, open my eyes to see Your blessings.
Open my ears to hear Your voice. Open my heart that I may
love You more. Amen
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

03/20/2011~~~food for thought~~~THE BEST IS YET TO COME

The Verse for Today:
"May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in him, 
so that you may overflow with hope by the power of the Holy Spirit." - Romans 15:13 

Lesson for Today:
Not only does the Bible contribute to our belief in the best is yet to be,
but the things of our daily lives reveal that this is true, too. 

The phrase, "the best is yet to be," is a positive affirmation that gives
life direction. It provides hope: there is more to come in life. Its the
spirit of expectancy; good things are going to happen. It is seen
through the eyes that look for opportunities that will be greater 
than ever. It is received through proper planning and work.
Desire is the fuel that makes it a reality. The best is yet to be!

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, strengthen my faith that
Your will is the best for me. .Amen.



Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

The best is yet to be!

Grant us the wisdom and strength to plan diligently and work faithfully, fueled by the desire to see Your good plans unfold in our lives. May we ever keep our eyes fixed on the greater things to come, trusting in Your perfect timing and provision. In Jesus' name, Amen.

03/20/2011~~~food for thought~~~THE NEEDED POWER TO LOVE AS WE SHOULD

The verses for Today:
"But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, forbearance, kindness, 
goodness, faithfulness, gentleness and self-control. Against such 
things there is no law." - Galatians 5:22-23

Today's Lesson:
"The fruit of the Spirit" is really the work of the Spirit in us. The Spirit
produces these character traits that are found in the nature of Christ.
They are the by-products of Christ's control ~ we cannot obtain them 
by trying to get them without His help. .

If we want the fruit of the Spirit to grow in us we must join our life to
His (see Jn. 15:4-5). ~ We must know him, love Him, remember Him,
and imitate Him. As a result, we will fulfill the intended purpose of the 
law ~ to love God and our neighbors. .

Which of these qualities do you want the Spirit to produce in you?

Prayer Suggestion:
O Holy Spirit, give us daily victories over sin in our daily
life and, above all, to power to love one another. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

If we want the fruit of the Spirit to grow in us we must join our life to His (see John 15:4-5). ~ We must know him, love Him, remember Him, and imitate Him. As a result, we will fulfill the intended purpose of the law ~ to love God and our neighbors. Which of these qualities do you want the Spirit to produce in you?

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, grateful for the gift of Your Holy Spirit. May the fruit of the Spiritlove, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-controlbe evident in our lives. Help us to abide in Christ, that we may walk in the light and bear the fruit that pleases You. Guide us to know You more, love You deeper, and imitate Your Son, that we may fulfill the law of love. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The fruit of the Spirit is really the work of the Spirit in us. The Spirit produces these character traits that are found in the nature of Christ. They are the byproducts of Christ's control ~ we cannot obtain them by trying to get them without His help. If we want the fruit of the Spirit to grow in us we must join our life to His (see John 15:4-5). ~ We must know him, love Him, remember Him, and imitate Him. As a result, we will fulfill the intended purpose of the law ~ to love God and our neighbors. Which of these qualities do you want the Spirit to produce in you?
subject: Cultivating the Fruit of the Spirit
verse_text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, forbearance, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness and self-control. Against such things there is no law.

03/26/2011~~~food for thought~~~IF WE CONFESS OUR SINS HE IS FAITHFUL TO FORGIVE US

Today's Verse:
"If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our 
sins and purify us from all unrighteousness." - 1 John 1:9 

Today's Lesson:
Confession is suppose to free us to enjoy fellowship with Christ.
It should ease our conscience and lighten our cares.
But some Christians do not understand how it works. 
They feel so guilty they confess the same sins over and over;
then they wonder if they might have forgotten something. .

Other Christians believe that God forgives them when they confess,
but if they died with unconfessed sin, they would be forever lost.
These Christians do not understand that God wants to forgive us.

He allowed His beloved Son to die just so He could offer us pardon.
When we come to Christ, he forgives all the sins we have committed.
We don't need to confess the sins of our past all over again, and we 
don't need to fear that God will reject us if we don't keep our slate
perfectly clean. .

Of course we should continue to confess sins, but not because failure 
to do so will make us lose our salvation. Our relationship with Christ is
secure. ~ Instead, we should confess so that we can enjoy maximum 
fellowship and joy with Him. .

Remember, ~ True confession also involves a commitment not to 
continue to sin. ~ We wouldn't be genuinely confessing our sins to God 
if we planned to commit them again and just wanted temporary forgiveness.

Remember, ~ We should always pray for strength to defeat temptation
the next time we face it. .

Question, ~ If God has forgiven us for our sins because of Christ's death,
why must we confess our sins? ? ?

Answer, ~ In admitting our sins and receiving Christ's cleansing we are,
(1) agreeing with God that our sin truly is sin and that we are willing to turn form it,
(2) ensuring that we don't conceal our sins from Him and consequently from ourselves. and
(3) recognizing our tendency to sin and relying on His power to overcome it. .

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, give us hearts to believe and to know ourselves
as we are. So then we may truthfully confess our sins, trusting in Your
forgiveness and mercy. Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

03/27/2011~~~food for thought~~~LET SUFFERING STRENGTHEN YOUR FAITH

Today's Verse:
"For it has been granted to you on behalf of Christ not only to believe 
in him, but also to suffer for him," - Philippians 1:29 

Today' Lesson:
Most people would say that Paul was unique. Paul considered it a privilege
to suffer for Christ. We do not by nature consider suffering a privilege.
Yet when we suffer, if we faithfully represent Christ, our message and
example affect us and others for good (see Acts 5:41).

Suffering has these additional benefits:
(1) it takes our eyes off of earthly comforts.
(2) It weeds out superficial believers.
(3) It strengthens the faith of those who endure.
(4) It serves as an example to others who may follow us. .

When we suffer for our faith, it doesn't mean that we have done something 
wrong. In fact, the opposite is often true ~ it verifies that we have been 
faithful. Use suffering to build your character. Don't resent it or let it tear
you down. .

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, give Your people grace to recognize that all
praise belongs to You alone, even during times of suffering. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

03/30/2011~~~food for thought~~~THE GREAT EXCHANGE

Today's Verse:
"God made him who had no sin to be sin for us, so that in him we might 
become the righteousness of God." - 2 Corinthians 5:21 

Today's Lesson:
Give this some thought: When we trust Christ, we make an exchange.
He takes our sin and makes us right with God. Our sin was laid on Christ
at His crucifixion. .His righteousness is given to us at our conversion. .

This is what Christians mean by Christ's atonement for sin. .
In the world, bartering works only when two people exchange
goods of relatively equal value. .

But God offers to trade for something completely worthless.
How grateful we should be for His kindness to us. .

Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, impress upon my heart the greatness of 
Your grace to me, by the power of Your Holy Spirit,
so that I can walk confidently by faith until I see You
gloriously face to face. .Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

His righteousness is given to us at our conversion. This is what Christians mean by Christ's atonement for sin. In the world, bartering works only when two people exchange goods of relatively equal value. But God offers to trade for something completely worthless. How grateful we should be for His kindness to us.
original_verse_text: God made him who had no sin to be sin for us, so that in him we might become the righteousness of God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your great love and mercy. You have made the ultimate exchange, taking our sin and granting us Your righteousness through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ. We are humbled by Your generosity, for we have nothing to offer that is worthy of such a gift. Help us to live with gratitude, reflecting the righteousness we have received and sharing the good news of Your atonement. In Christ's name, Amen.
reflection: Give this some thought: When we trust Christ, we make an exchange. He takes our sin and makes us right with God. Our sin was laid on Christ at His crucifixion. His righteousness is given to us at our conversion. This is what Christians mean by Christ's atonement for sin. In the world, bartering works only when two people exchange goods of relatively equal value. But God offers to trade for something completely worthless. How grateful we should be for His kindness to us.
subject: Exchanged for Christ's Righteousness
verse_text: God made him who had no sin to be sin for us, so that in him we might become the righteousness of God.

03/31/2011~~~food for thought~~~WHAT WONDROUS LOVE

Today's Verses:
"He was despised and rejected by mankind, a man of suffering, and familiar with pain. 
Like one from whom people hide their faces he was despised, and we held him in low 
esteem. Surely he took up our pain and bore our suffering, yet we considered him 
punished by God, stricken by him, and afflicted." - Isaiah 53:3-4 

Today's Lesson:
This man of sorrows was despised and rejected by those around Him, and He is
still despised and rejected by many today. Some reject Christ by standing against 
Him. Others despise Christ and the great gift of salvation. .Do you despise Him, reject, 
or accept Him?

When we think of all the years it would be before this was going to happen, we must
think of it as God pulling aside the curtain of time to let the people of Isaiah's day look
ahead to the suffering of the future Messiah and the resulting forgiveness made
available to all people. .

Prayer Suggestion:
O Lord, what a wondrous love is this that caused our Lord Jesus 
of bliss to bear the dreadful curse of my soul. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

We are saddened to know that He was despised and rejected, yet we are in awe of His willingness to suffer for our sake, that we might receive the gift of salvation. Lord, help us to never take for granted the immense love and sacrifice displayed on the cross. May we not despise or reject Christ, but rather, wholeheartedly accept Him as our Lord and Redeemer. We give You all the glory and praise. Amen.

04/01/2011~~~food for thought~~~YOU WANT THE TRUTH?

Today's Verses:
"But he was pierced for our transgressions, he was crushed for our iniquities; 
the punishment that brought us peace was on him, and by his wounds we are healed. 
We all, like sheep, have gone astray, each of us has turned to our own way; 
and the LORD has laid on him the iniquity of us all." - Isaiah 53:5-6 

Today's Lesson:
Isaiah says we are like sheep ~ no this is no April fool joke. .
Who wants to argue the point? ~ Are we not all guilty of straying?

Yet God sent His Messiah to bring us back into the fold. We have the
hindsight to see and know the identity of the promised Messiah, who
has come and died for our sins. .

But if we know all that Jesus did and still reject Him, ~ tell me why
people still think that their sins are no greater than that of the
ancient Israelites, who could not see what we have seen? ? ?

Have you given your life to Jesus Christ, the "Good Shepherd"
(Jn. 10:11-16), or are you still like wondering sheep?


Prayer Suggestion:
O Lord, what wondrous love, once again I pray, 
"What wondrous love this is." ~ That caused my 
Lord to bear the dreadful curse for my soul. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
